title: Code: CODE
name: code
description:
The element indicates an example of code, typically rendered in a mono-spaced font. The element is intended for short words or phrases of code; the 
 block structuring
      element (5.5.2, "Preformatted Text: PRE") is more appropriate
       for multiple-line listings. For example:

      The expression x += 1
      is short for x = x + 1.
